categories.body: Episodes of Avatar: The Last Airbender

value.text: Greg Baldwin (Uncle), Mark Hamill (Firelord Ozai), Jennie Kwan (Suki), James Garrett (Roku), Andre Sogliuzzo (Bumi), Victor Brandt (Pakku), Robert Patrick (Piandao), Keone Young (Jeong Jeong), Jennifer Hale (Kyoshi/June), Kevin Michael Richardson, (lion turtle), Tress MacNeille (Yangchen), Jim Meskimen (Kuruk)

Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno

paragraphs.body: "Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters" is the 19th episode of ${link_0} of ${link_1} and the 59th of the overall series. It debuted on July 19, 2008.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: "Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters" is the 19th episode of Book Three: Fire of Avatar: The Last Airbender and the 59th of the overall series. It debuted on July 19, 2008.

paragraphs.body: On the mysterious island, Aang seeks guidance from his past lives, but they insist he must take Fire Lord Ozai's life. The island is discovered to be a wise lion turtle that provides Aang with ancient knowledge of a forgotten art, energybending. Meanwhile, after June is unable to find the Avatar, Zuko decides to find his uncle instead, and Team Avatar meets the Order of the White Lotus, its leader being Iroh. After reuniting with Iroh, the team chooses to split up and go in different directions to help stop the Fire Nation. Sozin's Comet arrives and Phoenix King Ozai prepares to destroy the Earth Kingdom.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: On the mysterious island, Aang seeks guidance from his past lives, but they insist he must take Fire Lord Ozai's life. The island is discovered to be a wise lion turtle that provides Aang with ancient knowledge of a forgotten art, energybending. Meanwhile, after June is unable to find the Avatar, Zuko decides to find his uncle instead, and Team Avatar meets the Order of the White Lotus, its leader being Iroh. After reuniting with Iroh, the team chooses to split up and go in different directions to help stop the Fire Nation. Sozin's Comet arrives and Phoenix King Ozai prepares to destroy the Earth Kingdom.

paragraphs.body: At an ${link_0} ${link_1}, ${link_2} convinces the bounty hunter, ${link_3}, to use her ${link_4}, ${link_5}, to track the missing ${link_6} using the scent of his ${link_7}. The shirshu is unable to track him, however, and June explains that Aang is "gone". ${link_8} asks if Aang is dead, to which June clarifies that he is not dead, he just does not exist.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: At an Earth Kingdom tavern, Zuko convinces the bounty hunter, June, to use her shirshu, Nyla, to track the missing Aang using the scent of his staff. The shirshu is unable to track him, however, and June explains that Aang is "gone". Sokka asks if Aang is dead, to which June clarifies that he is not dead, he just does not exist.

paragraphs.body: Newly awoken on a strange island in the middle of the sea, Aang and ${link_0} wonder where they are, deducing they are not in the ${link_1} because the former can still ${link_2}. He decides to climb to the top of the island to see if they can discover anything.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: Newly awoken on a strange island in the middle of the sea, Aang and Momo wonder where they are, deducing they are not in the Spirit World because the former can still bend. He decides to climb to the top of the island to see if they can discover anything.

paragraphs.body: Zuko, realizing the group would not be able to track down Aang, comes to the conclusion that the only other person who could possibly defeat ${link_0} is ${link_1}. He brings back Iroh's rancid ${link_2} as a smell sample for Nyla to track. Nyla runs off to find the source and ${link_3} follows on ${link_4}, eventually being led to the breached Outer Wall of ${link_5} after a day-long journey. They decide to camp out for the night. The group is later woken up by fire surrounding their encampment. Several old masters, ${link_6}, ${link_7}, ${link_8}, and ${link_9}, show themselves and greet them.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: Zuko, realizing the group would not be able to track down Aang, comes to the conclusion that the only other person who could possibly defeat Ozai is Iroh. He brings back Iroh's rancid sandal as a smell sample for Nyla to track. Nyla runs off to find the source and Team Avatar follows on Appa, eventually being led to the breached Outer Wall of Ba Sing Se after a day-long journey. They decide to camp out for the night. The group is later woken up by fire surrounding their encampment. Several old masters, Jeong Jeong, Piandao, Pakku, and Bumi, show themselves and greet them.

paragraphs.body: Wandering around the island, Aang soon finds a large hexagonal symbol on the ground and, unable to bend it, deduces that it is not made of rock or normal earth. Lost for thoughts, Aang decides to contact ${link_0}, hoping he will know where this place is. However, Roku confesses to him that he has not the slightest idea as to where they are, but sees Aang is frustrated by the knowledge that he has to kill the ${link_1} to end the ${link_2}. Roku confesses that his own disciplined outlook on being the ${link_3} was ultimately what caused the War to happen, as sparing Fire Lord ${link_4} cost Roku his life. Roku tells Aang he must be decisive and disappears.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: Wandering around the island, Aang soon finds a large hexagonal symbol on the ground and, unable to bend it, deduces that it is not made of rock or normal earth. Lost for thoughts, Aang decides to contact Roku, hoping he will know where this place is. However, Roku confesses to him that he has not the slightest idea as to where they are, but sees Aang is frustrated by the knowledge that he has to kill the Fire Lord to end the Hundred Year War. Roku confesses that his own disciplined outlook on being the Avatar was ultimately what caused the War to happen, as sparing Fire Lord Sozin cost Roku his life. Roku tells Aang he must be decisive and disappears.

paragraphs.body: Toph wonders why they are surrounded by old people, and they reveal they are members of the ${link_0}, a secret organization focused on beauty and philosophy, and were summoned to Ba Sing Se by Iroh, the Grand Lotus. The gang exclaims they are looking for him and the masters agree to lead them to him. Bumi notices that their group is missing someone important and inquires about the whereabouts of Momo, to which Sokka responds that he and Aang are missing. Stating that Aang and Momo will be all right "so long as they have each other," Bumi continues to lead the others to the White Lotus camp to find Iroh.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: Toph wonders why they are surrounded by old people, and they reveal they are members of the Order of the White Lotus, a secret organization focused on beauty and philosophy, and were summoned to Ba Sing Se by Iroh, the Grand Lotus. The gang exclaims they are looking for him and the masters agree to lead them to him. Bumi notices that their group is missing someone important and inquires about the whereabouts of Momo, to which Sokka responds that he and Aang are missing. Stating that Aang and Momo will be all right "so long as they have each other," Bumi continues to lead the others to the White Lotus camp to find Iroh.

paragraphs.body: Back on the island, Aang summons Avatar ${link_0} for wisdom. She recalls her encounter with ${link_1} the Conqueror, severing ${link_2} from the mainland to stop Chin, inadvertently causing his death. Aang reasons that she technically did not kill Chin, but Kyoshi tells Aang she sees no difference and would have killed him herself to keep the world in balance. She tells Aang only justice will bring peace and disappears. Agitated by her response, Aang wishes he never asked Kyoshi for wisdom at all.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: Back on the island, Aang summons Avatar Kyoshi for wisdom. She recalls her encounter with Chin the Conqueror, severing Kyoshi Island from the mainland to stop Chin, inadvertently causing his death. Aang reasons that she technically did not kill Chin, but Kyoshi tells Aang she sees no difference and would have killed him herself to keep the world in balance. She tells Aang only justice will bring peace and disappears. Agitated by her response, Aang wishes he never asked Kyoshi for wisdom at all.

paragraphs.body: Along the way back to camp, Bumi revealed that he single-handedly liberated the city of ${link_0} during the ${link_1}. With an amazing display of ${link_2}, he freed himself from his cage and cast out Fire Nation buildings, laughing and eating ${link_3} as he launched Ozai's gigantic statue out of the city. The ${link_4} soldiers were powerless due to the eclipse, and helplessly fled. Bumi asks the others if they did anything interesting on the day of the eclipse; Zuko and Sokka look awkwardly at each other and claim that they did not.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: Along the way back to camp, Bumi revealed that he single-handedly liberated the city of Omashu during the Day of Black Sun. With an amazing display of earthbending, he freed himself from his cage and cast out Fire Nation buildings, laughing and eating rock candy as he launched Ozai's gigantic statue out of the city. The Fire Nation soldiers were powerless due to the eclipse, and helplessly fled. Bumi asks the others if they did anything interesting on the day of the eclipse; Zuko and Sokka look awkwardly at each other and claim that they did not.

paragraphs.body: Aang looks deep within himself and summons Avatar ${link_0} for wisdom. Kuruk explains that during his time as the Avatar he was laid back and let the four nations work their own problems out. However, ${link_1} the Face Stealer punished Kuruk for his laziness by dragging his love ${link_2} into the Spirit World. Kuruk blames himself for what happened to her, and tells Aang he must actively shape his own destiny, as well as the destiny of the world. When Kuruk disappears, Aang despairs that three of his past lives are telling him to do what he does not want to do.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: Aang looks deep within himself and summons Avatar Kuruk for wisdom. Kuruk explains that during his time as the Avatar he was laid back and let the four nations work their own problems out. However, Koh the Face Stealer punished Kuruk for his laziness by dragging his love Ummi into the Spirit World. Kuruk blames himself for what happened to her, and tells Aang he must actively shape his own destiny, as well as the destiny of the world. When Kuruk disappears, Aang despairs that three of his past lives are telling him to do what he does not want to do.

paragraphs.body: The gang arrives at the White Lotus encampment, and Zuko is shown to Iroh's tent. He sits in front of the tent, ashamed and worried that Iroh hates him for his betrayal. Katara sits and comforts him, believing that Iroh would forgive Zuko if he was truly sorry. Zuko enters the tent and finds his uncle asleep. He sits down to wait for Iroh to wake.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: The gang arrives at the White Lotus encampment, and Zuko is shown to Iroh's tent. He sits in front of the tent, ashamed and worried that Iroh hates him for his betrayal. Katara sits and comforts him, believing that Iroh would forgive Zuko if he was truly sorry. Zuko enters the tent and finds his uncle asleep. He sits down to wait for Iroh to wake.

paragraphs.body: Aang figures that since the three past lives he asked were not ${link_0}, they cannot possibly understand his position correctly. He summons the previous Air Nomad Avatar, ${link_1}, to ask her for wisdom on what he should do. Though they both agree that all life is sacred, Yangchen insists that, as the Avatar, he has a duty to protect the world. Aang argues that the monks taught him to detach himself from the world so his spirit can be free to achieve spiritual enlightenment, but Yangchen counters that the Avatar is incapable of detaching from the world, as it is the Avatar's sole duty, and insists Aang must do whatever it takes to protect it. After she disappears, Aang laments to Momo that he has no other choice but to kill Ozai.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: Aang figures that since the three past lives he asked were not Air Nomads, they cannot possibly understand his position correctly. He summons the previous Air Nomad Avatar, Yangchen, to ask her for wisdom on what he should do. Though they both agree that all life is sacred, Yangchen insists that, as the Avatar, he has a duty to protect the world. Aang argues that the monks taught him to detach himself from the world so his spirit can be free to achieve spiritual enlightenment, but Yangchen counters that the Avatar is incapable of detaching from the world, as it is the Avatar's sole duty, and insists Aang must do whatever it takes to protect it. After she disappears, Aang laments to Momo that he has no other choice but to kill Ozai.

paragraphs.body: The next morning, Iroh wakes up to find Zuko waiting for him. Zuko tearfully apologizes for all he has done, but before he can ask how to redeem himself, Iroh grabs and hugs him, surprising Zuko. Iroh states he was never angry at his nephew, but was afraid he had lost his way. Zuko admits that he had, but Iroh establishes that he found it again and did so by himself.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: The next morning, Iroh wakes up to find Zuko waiting for him. Zuko tearfully apologizes for all he has done, but before he can ask how to redeem himself, Iroh grabs and hugs him, surprising Zuko. Iroh states he was never angry at his nephew, but was afraid he had lost his way. Zuko admits that he had, but Iroh establishes that he found it again and did so by himself.

paragraphs.body: As a new day begins, Aang wakes and sees mountains in the distance moving closer, realizing that the island itself is moving. He swims around the side of the island and, seeing a giant arm paddling, understands the island is a gigantic sea animal and starts swimming toward its face.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: As a new day begins, Aang wakes and sees mountains in the distance moving closer, realizing that the island itself is moving. He swims around the side of the island and, seeing a giant arm paddling, understands the island is a gigantic sea animal and starts swimming toward its face.

paragraphs.body: Zuko asks for Iroh to stop the Fire Lord since Aang is missing, but Iroh says he is not sure he could defeat Ozai. He also believes it would not be the right way for the War to end, as history would only see it as a brother killing a brother for power, and that only the Avatar should defeat the Fire Lord. Iroh rejects his claim to the throne and tells Zuko he instead must take Ozai's place as Fire Lord to stop the War. Iroh believes Zuko has at last restored his own honor, and that his destiny is to restore the honor of the Fire Nation, while it is his own destiny to reclaim Ba Sing Se in name of the Earth Kingdom. Zuko must face his sister ${link_0} before claiming the throne, and Iroh insists he cannot do it alone. Zuko asks Katara to come to the Fire Nation with him and she gladly accepts. Sokka, Suki, and Toph plan to intercept the Fire Nation air fleets and help Aang if he needs it. Iroh and the rest of the White Lotus members bid the two groups farewell; Zuko and Katara on Appa, and Sokka, Suki, and Toph on an ${link_1}. When Zuko asks Iroh what he will do after he reconquers Ba Sing Se, Iroh responds by saying he will reopen his tea shop, the ${link_2}, and play ${link_3} every day.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: Zuko asks for Iroh to stop the Fire Lord since Aang is missing, but Iroh says he is not sure he could defeat Ozai. He also believes it would not be the right way for the War to end, as history would only see it as a brother killing a brother for power, and that only the Avatar should defeat the Fire Lord. Iroh rejects his claim to the throne and tells Zuko he instead must take Ozai's place as Fire Lord to stop the War. Iroh believes Zuko has at last restored his own honor, and that his destiny is to restore the honor of the Fire Nation, while it is his own destiny to reclaim Ba Sing Se in name of the Earth Kingdom. Zuko must face his sister Azula before claiming the throne, and Iroh insists he cannot do it alone. Zuko asks Katara to come to the Fire Nation with him and she gladly accepts. Sokka, Suki, and Toph plan to intercept the Fire Nation air fleets and help Aang if he needs it. Iroh and the rest of the White Lotus members bid the two groups farewell; Zuko and Katara on Appa, and Sokka, Suki, and Toph on an eel hound. When Zuko asks Iroh what he will do after he reconquers Ba Sing Se, Iroh responds by saying he will reopen his tea shop, the Jasmine Dragon, and play Pai Sho every day.

paragraphs.body: Aang finds that the swimming island is a ${link_0}, which stops swimming and lifts Aang onto its paw. Aang asks it for wisdom on how to stop the Fire Lord without taking his life. The lion turtle answers, "The true mind can weather all the lies and illusions without being lost. The true heart can tough the poison of hatred without being harmed. Since beginning-less time, darkness thrives in the void, but always yields to purifying light." The lion turtle brings up a paw, his two claws touching Aang's chest and forehead, causing a green light to illuminate. Aang does not understand the turtle's words, but is comforted by this wisdom. He is let on land and waits for the arrival of Fire Lord Ozai.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: Aang finds that the swimming island is a lion turtle, which stops swimming and lifts Aang onto its paw. Aang asks it for wisdom on how to stop the Fire Lord without taking his life. The lion turtle answers, "The true mind can weather all the lies and illusions without being lost. The true heart can tough the poison of hatred without being harmed. Since beginning-less time, darkness thrives in the void, but always yields to purifying light." The lion turtle brings up a paw, his two claws touching Aang's chest and forehead, causing a green light to illuminate. Aang does not understand the turtle's words, but is comforted by this wisdom. He is let on land and waits for the arrival of Fire Lord Ozai.

paragraphs.body: As night falls, the air fleets of the Fire Nation led by Ozai prepare to depart and watch as ${link_0} enters the Earth's atmosphere. Aang watches in anticipation as the sky turns orange-red.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: As night falls, the air fleets of the Fire Nation led by Ozai prepare to depart and watch as Sozin's Comet enters the Earth's atmosphere. Aang watches in anticipation as the sky turns orange-red.

paragraphs.body: This is the second episode in which Zuko uses Iroh's sandal to locate him. In "${link_0}", Zuko finds his sandal in the middle of the road, indicating that he is on the right path. In this episode, he uses the scent of Iroh's sandal to guide Nyla to his location.

links.body: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World

section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: This is the second episode in which Zuko uses Iroh's sandal to locate him. In "Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World", Zuko finds his sandal in the middle of the road, indicating that he is on the right path. In this episode, he uses the scent of Iroh's sandal to guide Nyla to his location.

paragraphs.body: This episode and the next episode are the only two in the series when there is no official Fire Lord present at the time.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: This episode and the next episode are the only two in the series when there is no official Fire Lord present at the time.

paragraphs.body: Despite Aang's previous encounters with both Avatar Kuruk and Avatar Yangchen in the Spirit World, the two Avatars introduced themselves to Aang due to the fact that, at the end of Aang's journey, Yangchen told him that his encounters would be a forgotten dream.

paragraphs.body: This is the second episode in which Avatar Kuruk and Avatar Yangchen appear and the first time their voices are heard. They first appeared as miscellaneous Avatars in "${link_0}" and were properly introduced in the online game, "${link_1}".
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: This is the second episode in which Avatar Kuruk and Avatar Yangchen appear and the first time their voices are heard. They first appeared as miscellaneous Avatars in "The Avatar State" and were properly introduced in the online game, "Escape from the Spirit World".

paragraphs.body: Avatar Kuruk mentions that he lost his love to Koh the Face Stealer. Aang met this spirit in "${link_0}".

paragraphs.body: The four "Old Masters" were each referred to in the title of the episode they were introduced: "${link_0}" (Bumi), "${link_1}" (Jeong Jeong), "${link_2}" (Pakku), and "${link_3}" (Piandao).
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: The four "Old Masters" were each referred to in the title of the episode they were introduced: "The King of Omashu" (Bumi), "The Deserter" (Jeong Jeong), "The Waterbending Master" (Pakku), and "Sokka's Master" (Piandao).

paragraphs.body: The episode's title is a reference to the Order of the White Lotus which consists of old masters, as well as the past Avatars who advised Aang and to the lion turtle, who is the oldest master of all.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: The episode's title is a reference to the Order of the White Lotus which consists of old masters, as well as the past Avatars who advised Aang and to the lion turtle, who is the oldest master of all.

paragraphs.body: In this episode, Aang contacts Avatar Roku for the last time in the series.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: In this episode, Aang contacts Avatar Roku for the last time in the series.

paragraphs.body: When Aang wakes up for the first time on the lion turtle, the lightning exit wound scar is on the wrong foot.

paragraphs.body: While on the lion turtle, Aang is seen wearing boots in various scenes, despite the fact that he was barefoot when he slept-walked onto the lion turtle in the previous episode. This happens several times throughout the episode.

section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: When Zuko brings his uncle's sandal as a smell sample, a close-up reveals that it is covered in flies. However, the flies disappear when the camera zooms out again.

paragraphs.body: When Bumi flashes back to when he freed Omashu, he was able to look at the eclipse without hurting his eyes.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: When Bumi flashes back to when he freed Omashu, he was able to look at the eclipse without hurting his eyes.

paragraphs.body: At one point during Bumi's liberation of Omashu, he launches eight earth pillars of equal size at the Ozai statue's face. However, only seven are seen hitting the face and they all differ in shape and size.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: At one point during Bumi's liberation of Omashu, he launches eight earth pillars of equal size at the Ozai statue's face. However, only seven are seen hitting the face and they all differ in shape and size.

paragraphs.body: When Iroh yawns as he wakes up before Zuko apologizes to him, Zuko is seen in the background looking down at the ground near his uncle. However, when the camera zooms in on Zuko, he is looking directly at Iroh.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: When Iroh yawns as he wakes up before Zuko apologizes to him, Zuko is seen in the background looking down at the ground near his uncle. However, when the camera zooms in on Zuko, he is looking directly at Iroh.

paragraphs.body: While Aang is treading water next to the lion turtle, the forest should have moved behind him and Aang should have stayed in place. Instead, Aang moved with it, as if he was still swimming.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: While Aang is treading water next to the lion turtle, the forest should have moved behind him and Aang should have stayed in place. Instead, Aang moved with it, as if he was still swimming.

paragraphs.body: In the original airing of the episode, the volume was muted for a few seconds when Bumi began talking about his reconquering of Omashu. This issue also previously affected the copy of the episode that Netflix used for their Instant Streaming service.

paragraphs.body: This episode was part of an event called "Countdown to the Comet". The new episodes of Avatar began airing on July 14, starting with "${link_0}", followed by "${link_1}", The Boiling Rock parts ${link_2} and ${link_3}, "${link_4}", "${link_5}", and finally ${link_6}.

links.body: Sozin's Comet parts one through four

section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: This episode was part of an event called "Countdown to the Comet". The new episodes of Avatar began airing on July 14, starting with "The Western Air Temple", followed by "The Firebending Masters", The Boiling Rock parts one and two, "The Southern Raiders", "The Ember Island Players", and finally Sozin's Comet parts one through four.

paragraphs.body: The scenes featuring Aang are very similar to the classic Hindu text ${link_0}. In the dialogue, prince Arjuna prepares to engage in a major battle when he realizes that the opposing army is populated by many of his friends and relatives, and thus becomes conflicted about fighting, despite being aware of their evil. In order to convince Arjuna of the importance of taking part in battle, Lord Krishna, avatar of the god Vishnu, appears in the form of his charioteer and counsels the prince about his duties as a member of the warrior caste and as someone tasked with following the righteous path. The arguments that Krishna gives in favor of participating in the battle are very similar to the arguments that the Avatars give to Aang, like Kuruk's advice on the consequences of inaction and Kyoshi's alluding to a greater good that would outweigh the evil of taking life.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: The scenes featuring Aang are very similar to the classic Hindu text Bhagavad Gita. In the dialogue, prince Arjuna prepares to engage in a major battle when he realizes that the opposing army is populated by many of his friends and relatives, and thus becomes conflicted about fighting, despite being aware of their evil. In order to convince Arjuna of the importance of taking part in battle, Lord Krishna, avatar of the god Vishnu, appears in the form of his charioteer and counsels the prince about his duties as a member of the warrior caste and as someone tasked with following the righteous path. The arguments that Krishna gives in favor of participating in the battle are very similar to the arguments that the Avatars give to Aang, like Kuruk's advice on the consequences of inaction and Kyoshi's alluding to a greater good that would outweigh the evil of taking life.

paragraphs.body: Generally, when Ozai makes an appearance, so does Azula, though this is the only episode in which he appears, and she does not.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: Generally, when Ozai makes an appearance, so does Azula, though this is the only episode in which he appears, and she does not.

paragraphs.body: When Zuko and the gang are conferring with the Order of the White Lotus at the campsite, he refers to his father as "Father Lord" instead of "Fire Lord". Toph even points out his mistake, but he does not acknowledge it. This verbal mistake is an actual psychological phenomenon called "${link_0}", which is thought to reveal unconscious conflicts or issues of varied natures.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: When Zuko and the gang are conferring with the Order of the White Lotus at the campsite, he refers to his father as "Father Lord" instead of "Fire Lord". Toph even points out his mistake, but he does not acknowledge it. This verbal mistake is an actual psychological phenomenon called "Freudian slip", which is thought to reveal unconscious conflicts or issues of varied natures.

paragraphs.body: Zuko and Iroh's reunion is very similar to the parable of the Prodigal Son. A young man leaves his father and brother to pursue friendships with sinful people, similar to how Zuko betrays Iroh for Ozai and Azula, ironically, Zuko's immediate family. After all the son goes through, he soon learns he can go back to his father. When he returns, he expects his father to severely reprimand him, only for the father to instantly welcome him back with open arms.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: Zuko and Iroh's reunion is very similar to the parable of the Prodigal Son. A young man leaves his father and brother to pursue friendships with sinful people, similar to how Zuko betrays Iroh for Ozai and Azula, ironically, Zuko's immediate family. After all the son goes through, he soon learns he can go back to his father. When he returns, he expects his father to severely reprimand him, only for the father to instantly welcome him back with open arms.

paragraphs.body: This is the second time in the four part special that someone points out other issues when Aang should be the main focus, the first time being when Sokka points out Zuko destroying his sand sculpture before he points out Zuko attacking Aang. Bumi realizes Momo is missing, and has to be told that Aang is gone as well. This comedy device is sometimes referred to as Burying the Lead.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: This is the second time in the four part special that someone points out other issues when Aang should be the main focus, the first time being when Sokka points out Zuko destroying his sand sculpture before he points out Zuko attacking Aang. Bumi realizes Momo is missing, and has to be told that Aang is gone as well. This comedy device is sometimes referred to as Burying the Lead.

paragraphs.body: This is the first and only episode in the series in which Iroh calls Aang by his name and not by "the Avatar".
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: This is the first and only episode in the series in which Iroh calls Aang by his name and not by "the Avatar".

paragraphs.body: The titular "Sozin's Comet" first appears at the end of this episode. The comet travels against the earth's rotation, traveling from east to west. That is why light from the comet was able to appear behind Aang's head in this episode, and why it is seen leaving in "${link_0}" across the sea opposite the direction from which ${link_1} Ozai's ${link_2} fleet came.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: The titular "Sozin's Comet" first appears at the end of this episode. The comet travels against the earth's rotation, traveling from east to west. That is why light from the comet was able to appear behind Aang's head in this episode, and why it is seen leaving in "Sozin's Comet, Part 4: Avatar Aang" across the sea opposite the direction from which Phoenix King Ozai's airship fleet came.

paragraphs.body: The place where Nyla leads the team to is very similar to the part of the Outer Wall that Iroh broke through during his 600-day siege of Ba Sing Se.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: The place where Nyla leads the team to is very similar to the part of the Outer Wall that Iroh broke through during his 600-day siege of Ba Sing Se.

paragraphs.body: The order in which Aang speaks with his previous incarnations, Roku, Kyoshi, Kuruk, and Yangchen, represents the Avatar Cycle in reverse: fire, earth, water, and air.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: The order in which Aang speaks with his previous incarnations, Roku, Kyoshi, Kuruk, and Yangchen, represents the Avatar Cycle in reverse: fire, earth, water, and air.

paragraphs.body: It was revealed in Avatar Extras that the writers wanted Momo with Aang on the lion turtle so Aang could talk to someone.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters
paragraphs.text: It was revealed in Avatar Extras that the writers wanted Momo with Aang on the lion turtle so Aang could talk to someone.

paragraphs.body: This is Avatar Roku's last speaking role in the series.
